TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT, DELETE, BYE, LIST, MARK, UNMARK, FIND
* Represents a Deadline Task. A Deadline object corresponds to
* a Task which contains a LocalDateTime field.
* @param deadline Deadline in yyyy/mm/dd HHmm format
* Represents an instance of the Duke chatbot, which
* Represents an Event Task. A Event object corresponds to
* a Task which contains a String time field corresponding
* Represents a Parser which parses input strings
* to Duke and returns the appropriate enum type
* Parses input string to return appropriate enum type.
* Represents a Storage object to handle saving and loading.
* Saves current tasklist as a file in specified filepath.
* Loads contents of current saved file into tasklist.
* @return The list containing the pre-saved tasks.
* Represents a Task. A Task object corresponds to
* a Task which may or may not contain an extension.
public Task(String name, String type, String extension) {
* Set a task as not done.
* Converts a string to compact format to be saved in the file
* @return the name of the task, along with an [X] if completed, [] otherwise
* Represents a List of Tasks, that will be saved to/loaded from
* Lists the string representation of all tasks currently in
* Prints tasks in the list that has name containing the specified keyword.
* Sets the task at specified index in the list as done.
* Sets the task at specified index in the list as undone.
* Adds a task to the list.
* Deletes the task at the specified index.
* Obtain the current size of the list.
* @return int containing size of the list
* Utility getter method to obtain the underlying list.
* the display of the user interface when the code is run.
* Begins displaying the User Interface in Terminal.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done: ");
System.out.println("The index you have provided is invalid");
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:  ");
System.out.println("The index you have provided is invalid");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println(" OOPS!!! The description of a todo cannot be empty.");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Oops! The correct format is : `deadline /by <type time here>`");
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task: ");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("Oops! The correct format is : `event /at <type time here>`");
System.out.println("Now you have " + tasklist.getSize() + " tasks in the list.");
System.out.println("The index you have provided is invalid");
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I do not know what that means :-(");
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
